title: Division
text: Remember that $$\frac{g}{f}$$ is the same as $$\frac{g}{f} x$$. All we have to do is divide the two functions.

title: Division
text: Let's write the quotient of these functions as a fraction: $$\frac{|x-3|}{\sqrt{x}}$$. Because the bottom of the function is a square root, we need to rationalize the function by getting rid of the square root in the denominator.
speech: Let's write the quotient of these functions as a fraction:  fraction, the absolute value of x minus 3, end absolute value over, the square root of x  . Because the bottom of the function is a square root, we need to rationalize the function by getting rid of the square root in the denominator.

title: Rationalization
text: To do this, we need to square $$\sqrt{x}$$ so that the denominator doesn't have a square root. So, we have to multiply $$\frac{|x-3|}{\sqrt{x}}$$ by $$\frac{\sqrt{x}}{\sqrt{x}}$$.
speech: To do this, we need to square  the square root of x  so that the denominator doesn't have a square root. So, we have to multiply  fraction, the absolute value of x minus 3, end absolute value over, the square root of x   by  fraction, the square root of x over, the square root of x  .

title: Multiplication
text: Since there is no way to simplify the product of $$\sqrt{x} |x-3|$$, this leaves us with $$\frac{\sqrt{x} |x-3|}{x}$$.
speech: Since there is no way to simplify the product of  the square root of x, the absolute value of x minus 3, end absolute value , this leaves us with  fraction, the square root of x, the absolute value of x minus 3, end absolute value over x,  .
